channel.title: Magpie
channel.description: Blog of writer and web developer Maureen Holland. Untidy nest of shiny things.

item.title: A Vanilla Personal Site
item.description: I rebuild my personal site every few years. This time, I decided I wanted to go as minimal as possible. It's been the most enjoyable iteration.

item.title: IndieWeb-ificiation
item.description: This is a catch-all post for a bunch of miscellaneous updates I've been meaning to do since last April: rel=me, microformatting, RSS, and garden bird themes.

item.title: RSS Club #1
item.description: What makes me a good front-end developer?

item.title: Thoughts on International Women's Day
item.description: I have mixed thoughts on International Women's Day, perhaps best encapsulated by the gender pay gap bot that notes discrepancies between a company's social media messages and real-world actions.

item.title: My CSS Mindset
item.description: I used to have Tim Gunn's catchphrase in my head during CSS development. A steady, insistent echo of “Make it work” encouraged me to brute force a lot of styles into place, condemning myself to a frustrating cycle of fixing something here only to find it was now broken there.
